channel.title: Changing the right click commands on an item
channel.description: hey, i was wondering how would i edit an item so when i right click it i can do numerous option, e.g: teleport to me, give items, full health etc thanks:)

item.title: Changing the right click commands on an item
item.dc:creator: @99ht 99ht
item.description:
@99ht wrote:

[quote=“Lordabyssal, post:6, topic:545777”]Server Sided!

Location: Server.models.players.packets

ClickItem.java (First option)

ItemClick2.java (Second option)

ItemClick3.java (Second option)

I would not start working with ItemClick4 or ItemClick5 just yet because you will have to deal with packets![/quote]
Thank’s a bunch man

Read full topic
item.source: Changing the right click commands on an item

item.title: Changing the right click commands on an item
item.dc:creator: @99ht 99ht
item.description:
@99ht wrote:

[quote=“adamgulka, post:4, topic:545777”]inventoryoptionshandler.java for what the options do
use a cache editor to change the options on the item[/quote]
i dont have a inventoryoptionshandler in my source or client, i’ve renamed the object and the options, i just need to know how to change the actions that they do

Read full topic

item.source: Changing the right click commands on an item

item.title: Changing the right click commands on an item
item.dc:creator: @99ht 99ht
item.description:
@99ht wrote:

[quote=“Lordabyssal, post:2, topic:545777”]Client Sided! for adding the options and Server Sided! for adding the commands/actions or what the option will do once clicked.

In ItemDef.java (Client Sided!)

Switch Statment:

case ITEMID:
itemDef.actions = new String[5];
itemDef.actions[0] = "Option 0"; //Warning [0] may weild or wear item!
itemDef.actions[1] = "Option 1";
itemDef.actions[2] = "Option 2";
itemDef.actions[3] = "Option 3";
itemDef.actions[4] = "Option 4";
break;

None Switch Statment:
“i” may not be the reference to the itemIds for you

if(i == ITEMID){
itemDef.actions = new String[5];
itemDef.actions[0] = "Option 0"; //Warning [0] may weild or wear item!
itemDef.actions[1] = "Option 1";
itemDef.actions[2] = "Option 2";
itemDef.actions[3] = "Option 3";
itemDef.actions[4] = "Option 4";
}

Server Sided is basic if you need help Server sided please post or edit.[/quote]
thanks!, im still unsure on what file i need to open to make the commands for the item

Read full topic
item.source: Changing the right click commands on an item

item.title: Changing the right click commands on an item
item.dc:creator: @Lordabyssal Lordabyssal
item.description:
@Lordabyssal wrote:

Client Sided! for adding the options and Server Sided! for adding the commands/actions or what the option will do once clicked.

In ItemDef.java (Client Sided!)

Switch Statment:

case ITEMID:
itemDef.actions = new String[5];
itemDef.actions[0] = "Option 0"; //Warning [0] may weild or wear item!
itemDef.actions[1] = "Option 1";
itemDef.actions[2] = "Option 2";
itemDef.actions[3] = "Option 3";
itemDef.actions[4] = "Option 4";
break;

None Switch Statment:
“i” may not be the reference to the itemIds for you

if(i == ITEMID){
itemDef.actions = new String[5];
itemDef.actions[0] = "Option 0"; //Warning [0] may weild or wear item!
itemDef.actions[1] = "Option 1";
itemDef.actions[2] = "Option 2";
itemDef.actions[3] = "Option 3";
itemDef.actions[4] = "Option 4";
}

Server Sided is basic if you need help Server sided please post or edit.

Read full topic
